wrwzqzBKemBM3_plFyKGaA.text: Very good Thai food! The spice levels are actually truly spicy and the food is very fresh. The owner is lovely

vXsrx1NQ13vIHKq1qGAwOA.text: My son and I ate here for lunch recently. The service was good, very friendly, got our food quickly. We ordered pork fried rice and  chow mein. Both came with a small crispy egg roll, soup and salad. You can order your food spicy, with hotness on a scale of 0 to 5. All of the food was very good. My only complaint was about the salad. I'm not a big fan of iceberg lettuce, which is what was served. I will definitely come back and for sure try some of the other menu items.

QiYSDsUtAsu7733HijEXRQ.text: This place is simply the best Thai food I have ever had.  My wife and I had Yellow Curry and Basil Fried Rice with Chicken.  Both were excellent.  The food is fresh and I believe this place is authentic.  We also had their coconut ice cream with crushed peanut.  It was the creamiest such ice cream I have ever had and had a nice hint of pineapple in it.  It goes very well.  You should know that their spicing is a bit hotter than most Thai places.  So I would recommend starting a notch lower on the heat until you get your bearings.

V_dpI4JD2vymR0RYsVbXNg.text: The food is great! I was really impressed with the presentation of the food too. Highly recommended

eVNYA_iaTLUQgxfTXB6vIg.text: This is the best Thai food in Ahwatukee if not Phoenix  We really enjoyed our dinner and the service was great  We had the chicken noodle and the level of spice was 2  3 would have been to much spice.  It was perfect

dRW5YLVPDjSCkJlYn8entg.text: This place is fantastic, fresh and a very good deal! One of the better Thai places not only in Ahwatukee but in town.

wpP3eE71vA42_Gw82U-VNQ.text: I wish I could give 3.5 stars. 3 seems like too few, but 4 almost seems like too many. The highlights were great, the lows were more annoying than anything else.  This place opened in our neighborhood a few months ago so my family and I decided to walk over and give it a try. It was delicious! My picky daughter and not-so-picky husband loved the coconut shrimp and chicken chow mein. My son ate up the edamame (it was oversalted but since you don't eat the husk it's no big deal). The fresh rolls were a disappointment. They were filled with the same salad mix that came with the coconut shrimp and the tofu filling was bland. The accompanying peanut sauce was thin, not creamy and rich. My husband had the beef salad with a side of rice and he loved it. The beef was cooked well and the plate was full of flavor. I had the avocado curry with tofu and it was incredible. I ordered it "thai hot" and it definitely had some heat. I was happy to have the complimentary coconut ice cream at the end of the meal.   The service needs some improvement. Our appetizers came quickly but the entrees took longer than expected, we even watched other diners, who arrived after us, receive their meals before us which is frustrating. The bathroom has a weird safety lock so you can't ever tell if it is locked--I thought it was broken and inconspicuously mentioned it to the host who gave me a drawn out explanation about the fancy lock. I know how to lock a door, I just didn't want anyone seeing my goodies over their pad thai.  It would be nice if they had smaller cups for children. The only cups with lids they had were styrofoam (cringe, the environment!) and enormous.   We will definitely go back, I look forward to this being our new neighborhood spot.

y8ZnEzOmSCsMyQtlDOB5bA.text: Good food. Good value. We had the drunken noodles, pineapple curry, and thai fried rice. Nice size portions, plenty for tomorrow's lunch. :) Close to our house. We'll be back!

BS2fJDm-bpTLadJVcNlLAw.text: I've had this place 3 weekends in a roll and it looks like its gonna be on my menu this weekend to come the food portions are good you definitely will have leftovers if your not sharing you're dish. The taste is of the food was great, customer service was good and the place was clean.  Try the coconut pineapple ice cream its light and tasty.  Two thumbs up definitely check this place out.

kAttsYD6sIN8dDncW1dyKA.text: A wide selection of dishes. All the the dishers were exellcent and the peanut sauce was among the best I have ever had. A free scoop of coconut ice cream was a nice touch, and since no alcohol was served we were able to bring our own wine. Ther service was excellent and very friendly and accommodating. The food was a litle bit slow in arriving. Given the number of patrons, an addition person in the kitchen would help. My wife and I were very satisified and will defiinte return with friends in tow.

u0_aEdWLoNCeGA_O7aK0ZA.text: Best Thai food in the metro. Best customer service, food quality and quantity, and best price.

gD-NONqTfq_OnfEJye_zBw.text: I work next door and have been wishing a good place would come in after the Hungry Howies left.  Luckily this Thai restaurant came in, and I must say they don't disappoint! I ordered a quick beef Pad Thai L3 special and a side of steamed veggies. The lunch specials comes with a soup or salad (I got the salad) and an egg roll. I was satisfied with everything! Veggies and salad had a nice fresh crunch, egg roll disappeared so fast into my belly that I was sad. I got a 3 spice and it was perfect! I'm not how far numbers go up in spices but with the 3 it had a kick but didn't take out from any flavors. I'm so glad that I don't have to cry on my way to work if I ever forget to pack a lunch. I would definitely recommend this place for a quick lunch!

jg9aIWXX29zFMHLX2jcARw.text: Unbelievable!  We went for lunch 3 days during our week in AZ.  Wish we could move this place to VA!! Staff and service was excellent.

o7CZdVw9_Pepb1EUbVnodQ.text: Best food .. best service .. this is my favorite Thai restaurant .. The beef salad is to die for..!!!! And seafood tom yum has a wonderful seasoning in the soup ..

xX27mI4J14CJ1Hn7an0VIQ.text: The husband and I tried this restaurant a couple months back and had a mixed experience. We went on a Saturday night and the place was fairly empty. We ordered the mango curry and the drunken noodles. We also receive a free Thai tea with check in (which was awesome!). The noodles were fantastic.... super spicy and delicious. I'd 100% recommend them. The curry was just ok. Not as thick as I would hope and also lacking in spice and flavor. The real issue was when the bill came. The waiter brought the bill and the mango curry was priced 3$ more than it had been priced on the menu. I asked the waiter about it, and he said that's how it rang up, but that he would get the manager (or owner? not sure). Another man came over, I showed him the menu where it said the curry was 9.99 (or something like that) and he told me that that curry was actually more expensive due to the mango, and they just hadn't updated the menu yet. He then said, I guess I can figure a way to discount it 'if you want.' Uh..... ya, I want. You can't just tell a customer the food they ordered off the menu was actually more expensive after they have already completed the meal..... that isn't how this works. What should have been an easy apologize and fix the bill ended up being an awkward moment that left me questioning the level of honesty of the management of the restaurant. Though I would recommend the food here (and may return for the yummy noodles), I would advise that you check your bill carefully.

yjeZGXiODC6uBMVjwySA_w.text: Not sure how this place has so many 5 star reviews. I ordered from here once through UberEats after learning they no longer delivered Thai Chilli 2 Go (my go to Thai place at the time) and found it to be the worst Thai I've ever had in my life. It was spicy, but bland. No real flavor -- just heat. Ordered the Spicy Basil and Panang Curry. Hopefully, it was just an off day. I've never ordered again and am not likely to.

4pChYj2KvX7l8tXHx-_kCA.text: Love the food. Love the staff. Probably the maximum variety among all thai places. Mango curry is yummy. Will definitely recommend if you're in for a delicious Thai food

FW8RItHPJUz8reEoJLNhCg.text: Has to be one of the cleanest Thai food places ever!  The food is awesome every time we visit. The staff is very attentive and courteous. Love this place!!

_6EBV2inroWsHcBa_7g15Q.text: We have never eaten anything but DELICIOUS food here! Tonight, I ordered the Crab Fried Rice. Soooo tasty. Sweet crab meat with cilantro, onion, and egg. Everyone at the table kept taking bites. The Tom Kha soup is the very best I've ever had. You will not be disappointed eating here.

JcKmuyq_YXQNN9sPCOaVsA.text: The food was very good. Next time I would not order my food so hot, but I FINISHED IT ALL. The service was excellent. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates quality Thai food.

blA-ncRidAvU3X-lNN-97g.text: I've been here multiple times and the food is always great! I've never had a problem here. I usually get their yellow curry and chicken fried rice. The sizes are decent for the price too!

z2tpBJI0ARoqP-3YL0Rifg.text: Amazing service and very good food! Many options on the menu and very tasty coconut/pineapple ice cream! We ordered the Pad Thai and the sweet & sour chicken. The portions are a good size & I have leftovers for another meal! Will be returning!

UsYf1cTspwysZ4sBkr-Z4g.text: Let me just start out by saying the food at Thai Delight is EXCELLENT, and easily worth writing a letter home about. The service is usually fantastic, especially when you have the pleasure of talking with the owner or the other nice young lady that works the Our office is right down the street, so we typically frequent this place at least once or twice a week. I've tried various things on the menu, but I always find myself gravitating back towards the Pad Thai (to die for!). In each of our previous visits, the plates were more than enough food, with no shortage of chicken, shrimp, tofu, etc. However, when our food arrived for lunch today, I couldn't help but notice that there was only one sole, lonely looking shrimp aboard my plate full of Pad Thai noodles and tofu. Having been here several times before and being fully aware of the normal lunch portions, I approached the bald gentleman sitting at the register, and inquired why there was only one shrimp with my food. His flat answer to me was that the 'size of the lunch portion includes one shrimp'. I told him this confuse me because we've only gone for lunch before and it was never like that in the past. He simply said that's how it's supposed to be, and left it at that.  When I returned to our table, a young lady walked in, and the bald dude acknowledged her like he knew her as soon as she sat down. When the waitress arrived, the lady ordered my same dish. When her food arrived, I couldn't help but notice that hers had 3-5 shrimp on it. Lmao  As petty as it sounds, understand this is not strictly about "shrimp", or getting a refund (which I Do Not want). It's about the principle of fessing up when a mistake is made, no matter the size of said mistake. Moreover, if the standard is what it is, maybe make it that way across the board if you'd like to keep returning customers just that - returning.   Just my $.02

ZPDz31BY8mU_R5e1xAWo9Q.text: Thai Delight 4645 E Chandler Blvd Ste 106 Phoenix, AZ 85048  A large group of us descended on this restaurant for dinner. We all wanted to try different dishes and compare them to previous experiences.  Companion ordered Egg Rolls and received 5 of them that were crispy and filled with veggies. Personally, I wanted to have the Mee Krob which had large pork slices and was very good.   Dishes that were ordered included Duck Curry (nicely cooked and flavored) and Tom Ka Pork soup, which was quite tasty. One of our party ordered the #18 Platter, which was huge and had shrimp satay and wontons which were made of rolled rice paper. Another ordered #2 which were soft rice paper rolls with shrimp, noodles and peanut sauce Also ordered was Pad Thai which was declared to be very good.  For main courses, Drunken Noodles were ordered and were excellent but considered a bit too spicy.  Sweet and Sour Pork came in manageable pieces and was also very tasty.  The Red Curry Chicken was excellent and had nicely balanced flavors.  Another of the group ordered Pad Prik King which was very good and had a wonderful sauce.   The Panang Curry was very good, but not spicy enough for one member of our party.  Other items ordered were the Chicken Satay and the Thai Delight.   It was generally agreed that service was excellent. The restaurant was nice and clean and restrooms were properly equipped and clean.  4 stars for excellent service, excellent food, and nice atmosphere.

hromxRKUMsYG4oUoIyujVg.text: How can I just find this place? It's pretty amazing.   I had the coconut soup with vegetable, as suggested by my server. It was WONDERFUL! Just right amount of sourness and saltiness in this flavorful coconut soup base. All kinds of vegetables were included. I was surprised! And they have an option for cup sized soup, which a lot of places don't offer but perfect for a side dish for a single person! Awesome!  My entree was the eggplant dish with tofu, mild. Delicious! The flavor was a little bit on the strong side, but balanced perfectly with the relatively bland eggplant and tofu. Their rice was great too! You can tell if an Asian restaurant is good or bad just by tasting their rice, for it's such an important but skillful main dish for all Asian cuisine. They did a great job. I was really satisfied.  And before the check, my server brought me a small cup of coconut ice cream, and told me it was free for all their customers. I was sold! The ice cream was very tasty too, with pineapple and coconut pieces in it! My FAVORITE! Yum! I came here pretty late at night, but they never tried to rush me out the door, and treated me very politely and nicely instead. I'm very glad I came here tonight.  Overall, I had a very pleasant and satisfying dinner experience here. Thank you! I would highly recommend it if you're craving some great Asian food. I'll definitely come back again myself and maybe bring some friends with me as well.

uMEwsQgxcoyRdjikwaIrww.text: First time here, had the Drunken Noodles and Pad Thai it was very good. Spice level is on target. The homemade ice cream was delicious. Service was friendly and fast. It is very clean as well. Will be back!

It was really tasty snd ordering it medium was the perfect "hot" for us. The ice cream was delicious too. Pineapple/coconut.  Easy access for handicapped and easy parking.  We will be back soon. Eat Local!!

dh_IKJrOyCanPJqL1mLt-A.text: I got a takeout order of satay chicken and the minced pork salad (laarb). As I've already noted, their satay is wonderful: 6 generous skewers of perfectly seasoned, grilled chicken. But I love Thai pork salad, so I gave them a chance to impressed me. And boy, did they! The take-out serving was huge, fresh, , herbal, salty, crunchy, tangy and spicy (I asked for level 2 and my mouth is still tingling). The only thing that threw me a little is the addition of short pieces of very chewy, thick noodles (think udon). I wasn't wild about that texture being added to the mix, but it certainly didn't affect the tastiness of the dish.  So now I can add one more dish to my list of sure bets at this restaurant.

r9MgBeEXrx5xy6y0bkbl8A.text: The food is solid, but the service is lacking. Came in with my family, and our order was served to us piecemeal. It took so long that I requested that the last 2 plates, that were yet to come out be served to go.   Next time, we will just order take out.

HY22fkQxy9wtnKZYrg9pWw.text: Delicious.  I had the Shrimp Thai Fried Rice.  The complimentary salad was simple but fresh and delicious.  My lunch companion had the eggplant and said his was good as well.

yl9_nrw2eM4jlT8dHKjQRw.text: Great food. Good size portions and service was exceptional.  I had Tom khan soup My partner had garli and pepper with beef. Both dishes were more than we could eat.

JKKQzZdTMyQh_TS8xY9R-w.text: Thai delight has been my go to Thai place for a while now ..it never came to my mind to leave good words for them. One of the best Thai place for food and ambience in the area. Good portion sizes for the price. Great service.

Turned down the coconut pineapple ice cream the first few times due to being so full, but this latest time I tried it and it was fantastic!

0tEvySNlLB3hoCxvy6MHAA.text: The food is good, service was pleasant but while I was sitting trying to eat the guy from the kitchen kept coming out and looking over the wall at me..his head just darting over here and therex to the point where I was kinda uncomfortable.. I don't know I just felt rushed..  Other then that the food came out fast and it included a salad bar for lunch.

uifksFD1eEP05X9EZwJb_Q.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet! I've been coming here for a couple years. I've probably eaten here about dozen times. I typically get a Thai curry, with an appetizer and a dessert. I've tried most of their curries and they're really delicious. I've also tried their chicken satay, egg rolls, pot stickers and crab puffs. All of which are very nice. I really like their sticky rice and mango too. The staff and owner are always pleasant and often offer a water while you wait. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the prices feel a little high to me. And I've noticed a few times when the menu price was cheaper than what I was actually charged. But I love their food so I'll come back from time to time when I'm craving Thai food.

u0ZDz7J3HPz4ZAbCFyBxLw.text: Absolutely delicious, truly hit the spot. They're a small place but worth any wait. Items were fresh, curries were aromatic. Try the Thai Iced Teas with coconut milk. Portions were good sized and the price was right. Keep it up!

WzkIUBVlyoCXUzGoxRXWGQ.text: The avocado green curry is excellent as well as the coconut soup in the ornate shareable serving bowl. The free coconut ice cream after dinner is a real treat. Service is great, but the kitchen can be slow.

I have been going here for almost 2 years since I moved to Arizona and I haven't tried anything here that I didn't like. The owner is great, very respectful and appreciative of his customers.

We had the massaman curry, pad thai, and the thai tea. We were impressed with everything and this will definitely be our new go to spot. Service was excellent!

Lne9dT0FFtfcGv8isSJItw.text: I placed a to-go order over the phone and from that moment through to when I picked up my food the service was awesome. When I arrived I checked in and got a free Thai tea (so yummy), and my food was ready to go. I tipped a few dollars being so blown away by the service, but wish I would've tipped more! The food was amazing - hubby and I shared the pineapple fried rice with chicken. The portion was enough for about 4 servings, and we also had the crab puffs and egg rolls as appetizers. It was all so so good and we will definitely be returning to try some other things on the menu.

s_RyMsegWFjZoAadi1TUYw.text: Very satisfied with the food. Price is reasonable too.  One of the very rare Thai restaurants I like in town.

Thai noodles are clear and different than Italian styles and rice based.  Thai Delight cooked them and the chicken nicely. Sticky Rice is a sweet rice dumpling in coconut milk with mango bits and is very tasty. Everyone was friendly and food was ready to pick up. Prices vary depending on item. If you want to try Thai , try Thai Delight!

It my 10 egg rolls (I spent over $38). I understand Grubhub May have made an error but I'm your customer!  1st and last time.

InIP_Gs2IpOrpkZm0jyOyg.text: The food at this place is bomb.  However, the service is severely lacking tonight.  People who came in after us were served before us.  Furthermore, they brought out my date's food (who was finished eating) by the time they brought out my food (teriyaki chicken).

047xsJ0f70hXKrrJj-xyKA.text: I'm perplexed by the rave reviews because this was one of the most dry and bland Thai meals I've ever had. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with shrimp and there was no hint of sauce whatsoever. It's like they forgot something. It was difficult to eat being that dry so I had to add my own sauce -- whatever was in my fridge and I did not have anything Thai or appropriate for this entree but it was better than nothing. Very disappointed in the drunken noodle dish. If I didn't order it to go, I would have returned it.  I also had a the glass noodle soup with vegetables and tofu. They did not provide enough broth so it wasn't really soup. The broth was flavorless and again, just seemed to be missing something. It tasted like plain water with no seasoning whatsoever, vegetables and clear noodles. Overall I was let down by the food. What kind of Thai restaurant has zero flavor in their food? I won't order from them in the future nor recommend this restaurant.   The good things: my order was ready when it was supposed to be, the meal came with a bottle of water which was a nice surprise hence the extra star, and the man who worked the register was nice. The restaurant seemed busy with a lot of pick up orders.

2qJ3G4hYzroV-GK8DdnB2Q.text: Came on a Wednesday night and there was no one we got our pick of any table.  About 20 mins later there was one other table occupied.  The food was good typical Thai food.  The decor was modern and clean - not the typical Houston Chinatown hole in the wall.  It was a quiet night since at the end of our meal the chef and owner came out to the front of the house.  I chose a safe beef broccoli.  The meat quality was good and tasty.  The sauce was a little sweet for my liking.  Also my friend wasn't expecting her fish to be fried and the sauce was definitely sweet - it looked like sweet and sour.  Yelp check in a glass of thai tea made my friend's day after a long project workday.  I personally am meh about thai tea.  The complimentary coconut pineapple ice cream was a nice treat.  The bowl was iced to - it kept the ice cream really cold.  It is like an iced beer mug - it just makes the ice cream or beer tastier.  It was a good casual Thai meal while traveling for work.

JpYqpoqKFyeRDdRjULVSfQ.text: I'm writing this as I sit here. I got here at 7:50pm and ordered food at around 8:00pm.    We ordered two appetizers, one soup, two entrees, and one drink.   It is now 8:27pm and one appetizer came out. We ate our appetizer pretty fast because we were famished. It is now 8:31pm and nothing else has come. The second appetizer came out at 8:35. We received the rest of our food at 8:43pm. We finished our meal, paid the bill, and left promptly at 9:01pm.   Generally, I am a very patient person. However, tonight, I was irritated. I do not understand how it took almost half an hour to receive two fried appetizers and a cup of soup. I was also annoyed that they forgot the drink. I also felt bad because the couple next to us was receiving the same level of "service" and their child was really hungry.   I have worked as a waiter in a similar restaurant of size and cuisine with the same number of staff members. Our average time from order to appetizer to entree was 5 minutes and 10 minutes.   This restaurant somehow managed 27 minutes to appetizer and 16 minutes to entrees. I'm not placing the full blame on the waiter. I'm placing blame on the entire establishment.   I will give credit that the food was good (note two stars instead of one) but it was accompanied by poor logistics, timing, and service. It was very disappointing and I have to say that I will not return.

wF-g4-u24kET-THHVu3_RA.text: Great Thai food. This is my second visit and both times have been excellent. Love their Panang Curry. Try the Thai Tea. After dinner, we were given coconut pineapple ice cream, made by the restaurant, at no charge. A tasty end to a great meal. Give them a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai tea

2jNMfmO4mgMTe56a5--9gA.text: This place is mediocre, nothing really special. We came to this place on a Saturday around 6pm. The wait was ridiculously long. The moment we sat down it took around 5minutes for a waitress to come take our drink requests. We ordered the Tai Tea, it took another 15-20 min to receive our drinks. We decided to put on a timer the moment we got our teas and it took another 45minutes to receive our food. So prepare to have a LONG wait time when you come here.  The food was ok - Nothing special. the coconut shrimp has sweet coconut shavings that made it a little too sweet for my liking.The Chicken Pad Tai was good. and the drunken noodles were ok. The dishes were skimpy on meat so we got more noodles than meat. The spice is mild- so if you like spicy food make sure you order up a heat level.  The service was great and apologetic about the long wait time but it was still longer than what I was hoping for. I'd come here again someday but I wont be rushing to come here.

t2DvdnPKiPHfJzJqAfe0IA.text: This has to be one of the best Thai restaurants I have been to. A lot of the places around the valley seems to have dishes that use the same base for curries, which results in a dish that doesn't have too much of a flavor profile. My mom and I went here for lunch and ordered our regular dishes, chicken pad thai and red curry. I was expecting the standard flavor that these dishes have that I've experienced with other Thai restaurants, but to my surprise these dishes had a lot more flavor compared to other places. The vegetables were also very fresh and not overcooked. I think it's best to go during lunch because of the value and the great amount of food that comes along with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Free Thai tea with Yelp check in!
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken red curry and chicken pad Thai. So dang delicious!

lDCx7s03gR9DD7gf7dMiAw.text: Amazing service and food. They sure do not skip on  the portion size and had plenty of chicken, basil, and veggies in everything.  Walked out full, happy, with a sizzling experience that came with plenty of leftovers... coconut pineapple ice cream helped cool the mouth. Yummy all the way around.

hVIIOMhlsVuOchAVlSoRSQ.text: Me and my husband went to this place for lunch. They have an extensive selection  on their lunch special menu. I ordered the spicy basil chicken and my husband got the panang chicken. Both tasted good with generous portion for thai food. For my thai basil chicken,they use ground chicken in the dish, but I think it would better they use chicken slices instead. My husband said the panang was good but he had better panang somewhere before. He felt the panang has more of coconut milk taste than the panang sauce in it. Lunch comes with soup, salad, and egg roll. They have a designated area where you grab your own soup and salad.  We also got free thai tea from yelp check in and they are so good...one of the best thai tea I've had! Customer service is excellent.The decor of the place is very nice and sophisticated . We will definitely come back and try different food on their menu!

dHNIn3UZZwOL7obE0BTqsA.text: My family's favorite Thai place!!! Always good and the staff is friendly and attentive. Feels like we are part of their family when we eat here. Tried many things on their menu, cannot go wrong with anything.

i9cqvmfihaBjUVNRnCJQ5w.text: We're new to the area and Thai Delight has become our go-to place for really good Thai.   Great food, very quick and friendly service, and good prices make this a winner.   As a meat eater, I hate ordering an Asian dish and end up searching through the veggies for a piece of meat.  That doesn't happen here as there is an abundance of meat in the dishes they serve.  My favorites are the drunken noodle and pas Thai.  You won't be disappointed!

PRdQ683RZivMqcrJoVSXGA.text: We love Thai Delight! Fantastic service and everything is delicious! We especially love the mango curry. Our favorite Thai restaurant in Ahwatukee and the valley!

sW_awUlvsJGQyj-BWW61Tw.text: Very good food. We like it spicy and ordered a 5 the hottest on their spicy scale. I ordered red curry, next time I'll order it without green bell peppers because as personal taste I don't like the them but the other than pulling out a few stray green bell peppers it was seasoned well and had a nice spicy flavor and the rice that was served with was enough for me to share and was good too. My husband ordered drunken noodles with combination of beef, chicken and shrimp, I don't know what drunken noodles are but it was delicious.  The service was great but there were only two tables of customers. I hope this place gets more business because the employees are attentive and kind and the food was great.  The restaurant was very clean and well cared for which is important to me as good food and good service.

ArJpKzy1Yaw-tkbfYnDsGg.text: We absolutely loved this cute new Thai restaurant! I love the way it's decorated inside, it feels very hip! Our server was excellent and was very attentive. We ordered the spicy basil with chicken extra Thai hot and it did not disappoint! Wonderful flavor and the perfect amount of spice! We also got the phat prik khing in medium and it was so good and quite unique compared to others that I have had. I love how it came with a variety of vegetables. We also got a Thai iced tea that came free with our meal from our yelp check in! Finally, the owner brought us out two bowls of homemade coconut ice cream! It was so creamy and delicious and had little specs of pineapple throughout. What an amazing experience! We will definitely be back over and over I'm sure!

_ErwnI4S0M5NXI6vh72jxw.text: I think Thai Delight deserves a second chance, but next time I'll dine in. I ordered a to-go box of vegetarian chow-mein noodles and was excited for my Thai splurge. I was in luck, my order was finished super quickly.  Inside I discovered that they also had Thai tea (a soft spot of mine!) and rushed off with my take-out to cram a quick dinner before other plans for the night. I was super hungry, and disappointed to say the least, as I carefully opened my styrofoam container, tied neatly in a plastic bag to find that napkins and eating utensils are not, apparently, included in the order. I was nowhere near silverware.   Aside from not being able to eat my dinner ... the place was cute, but completely empty at around 4pm on a Saturday. I saw one other person snag a takeout bag just before I walked in, and wondered why it was so empty. I assumed it must be because the little restaurant is tucked into a shopping mall area next in an area with lots of empty office space. When  I was finally able to eat, the noodles were decent but had lost much of their appeal after my quest to find a way to eat them.... trying first to use two plastic straws I happened to have in my car... and failing miserably. #fail.

cwlH1HJ6OqCTPpeHiwr17w.text: I have been back many times, mostly when I get off work and feel like some Pad Thai (Thai comfort food for me) for takeout. With take out they give you a bottle of water which I feel is a nice touch for over the top customer service. Something almost all restaurants charge extra for.  Went back last week for lunch with a friend. This is the first time I've had lunch at Thai Delight. My friend had the Massaman Curry with chicken and I had Garlic and Pepper with chicken sliced (lunch menu shows ground chicken). My friend seems to enjoy her food by not saying much but her plate will be clean when finished. Lol  So I'm assuming she liked it. I loved my dish so much that I will order it again. It had lots of veggies, which I'm always looking for. A lot of places will only put the standard fare of carrots, peppers and onions. Whatever they put in the broth is divine! I think it's a hint of ginger. The pepper in the name comes from black pepper (I think). Even tho it's a lunch portion I took about half home (I'm not a light eater).  With lunch they had a soup and salad bar. The salad choices are limited so don't come expecting to fill up on it. Not sure if the soup changes, that day it was egg drop soup. I added greens onions to it from the salad bar. A spring roll accompanied our entree as well.  My total bill with a Thai Iced Tea was under $13. Stupid me, I checked in and forgot to redeem my free tea! Still good value for your buck.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Thai and Pumpkin Curry

2KWu5ZpM7xtcbbT2ON8WOg.text: Wow all of the food we ordered was outstanding!!!! I ordered the avocado curry with chicken man that was excellent! I have been to Thailand so my reference is good. This place as far as I am concerned the best Thai food in AZ that I have found! The chicken satay is on spot! Most places don't take care on how they prepare this appetizer but they do. Even the cucumber-salad is really  good that comes with it. The peanut sauce was great as well. The staff is excellent and the owners came out to see how everything was. That means a lot to me and shows they really care about their guests! My wife loved her Pad See Yu and I tried it and it was excellent. Not dry like other places.   If you like Thai food try this place you won't be disappointed and you probably will fine it might be your favorite as well!!!!!

There is plenty of seating and the atmosphere is pleasant. If you like Thai food, give Thai Delight a try.

q8dpolSPN0b3jXteEqp03A.text: I had the chicken green curry. The food was amazing and the server was really nice. I'm giving it three stars because the owner was extremely rude to my friend. He needs to learn customer service or something. It was very unacceptable on how he talked to her.

Will be going back for more!

EeOJT_-E53ukDTg8fuNILw.text: Lovely little place, very clean and very stylish. Excellent for small groups or a date. We ate there once and ordered a pick up once. z6xQ7qNPoHihpIozBnj-Gw.text: Fantastic new Thai restaurant. Food is great, can't beat their lunch specials. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

Basil rice - lots of good veggies & flavor. Yellow curry with tofu - big chunks of potatoes and tofu, and the flavor was excellent. I ordered spice level 2 (medium) and it was perfect. Consistent flow of to go orders while we were there. We were the only customers at 5:30, by the time we left there were at least half the tables filled. Would definitely eat here any time I'm in Chandler or Phoenix.

1oXyraQMOyB41KuMqqVSlg.text: Some Serious Thai Food here - loved the Thai Fried Rice and Spicy Garlic Basil noodle. Fresh and level 2 was nice spice but not overwhelming.  I'll be back!

So dissatisfied and disappointed. I love Thai food and was hoping this would be the place since we moved to chandler!

s-MW_NiSEpNUj9RwUQG7Cg.text: Great Thai food right in Ahwatukee!  We love this place.  Our favorites include the Appetizer platter, Thai fried rice with Shrimp and any of the curry plates. Service is always fast and friendly.

pYEOH7VKbSvvpRLGQvVkIg.text: We meet our friends for dinner often at Thai Delight & have always been pleased with the food & service. The red curry is a little too spicy for me & it can't be ordered to be made a little milder. One of our favorite places!

vycvxtYHx2dafY6sJrF4HQ.text: Great authentic Thai food.  Excellent service.  I will now have to try all the different dishes in the menu.  The Crying Tiger dish was excellent.  So far I tried the usual Pad Thai, Panang Curry and Thai Fried Rice - all excellent. Coming back again.

faYOaUil4xMXQj703QdR6w.text: Visited today for lunch and was blown away! Will for sure be returning. I had the yellow curry, and was completely stuffed. I couldn't eat the soup that came with it and had that for dinner. I can't wait to try more of the recommended entrees! Carlo assisted me and he was really thoughtful. New favorite Thai place in Ahwatukee!

lTGDbj1uSwPQ-aBDLHBVrw.text: The service was very good. The food was fresh and tasty especially the egg rolls and pad thai. The free scoop of ice cream after dinner was a nice touch.

tfqGPzva7O9WMH55nWULPQ.text: Try the peanut curry, and the fresh spring rolls. The owners are super friendly, and the atmosphere was great!!!

Nr_FAnHnXdqb3KIByue2ag.text: My fiancee and I each have a dish to test a new Thai place.  Her's is Mee Krob and mine is Pad Prik King.  Both at Thai Delight exceeded any we've had. I am based in L.A. but have had Thai food all over the country and this is as good as it gets.  She is from Chicago and has traveled a lot too.  We were both impressed.  They also make one of my favorites that not every Thai place makes, Pumpkin Curry.  It was very delicious as well. They will make things as spicy or not spicy as you specify which is useful for all different palettes. I really can't say enough about a simple place that just has the best darn flavor around.  That's what it's all about.

RIDD7SVDC_QB_9-eF7CRRQ.text: Fried Calamari, nice and crispy with a delicious sweet and sour sauce, one of my go to appetizers.  I also tried the Tom Kha soup.  Very delicious coconut soup, that always hits the spot.   Also the Spicy Basil is a must try.  Nothing spectacular, just well cooked, and flavorful Spicy Basil.    You can tell that Thai Delight uses fresh ingredients, the food here just taste better than more other Thai places in the area.    My wife loves the Phad Thai and usually does not order anything else.    We highly recommend Thai Delight, if you are looking for good thai, start here, you will not be disappointed.

q7oYJ5UwDKeaiqYobifwUw.text: Food and service always exceptional.  Favorites are the chicken noodles, tom ka soup, and any of the curries.  The ice cream is a nice treat. Our go to place for Thai food.

HoBgPkT-XV1OX6cIjQa3zg.text: Best Thai restaurant in Ahwatukee. Love everything I have ordered. The beef pad see ew and yellow curry with vegetables are my favorite. The decor is great as well and the owners are very nice. Will be ordering dinner there tonight. Highly recommended!

NdguKLovpP4UKnQYAH2kVw.text: This place is so good! The food is delicious, the staff are so friendly, and the restaurant is immaculately clean. We haven't had a single item that we haven't liked. Do yourself a favor and eat here.

B8bzF2gCx1hKoWkTtiK31A.text: Vary clean and great food. If you are looking for good Thai food then come here. Everyone here are vary nice and professional.

TsmTC1k5F8_WtK-wxmPAsg.text: Super yummy drunken noodles. I got a level 3 for spice but I definitely could've gone higher up in level. Staff was super nice and even offered bottled water. I'm going back again tonight lol

Id7A0SJ80TojoIDjh-Rjrw.text: Overall probably the best dining experience of any thai place I have been to in the valley. The waiter was attentive, the place was small and cozy, but also very clean, and the food was above average. I enjoyed the environment and the fact that you didn't feel crowded in the area.  I ordered a dish of pad thai, with beef substitute. All said and done it was a quality meal with delicious ingredients. I had ordered the second spiciest level (4, out of a potential 5) but felt that it didn't hit the high notes of spiciness that I had expected. Aside from it being physically hot in temperature when brought to the table, once it cooled down I was able to dig into it without any sort of push back from the spices. So in that regard it left me a little uncertain of what to even expect in a subsequent visit should I order level 5.  I feel like maybe they're pulling punches to appeal to a more... European-descended clientele. In my past experiences with more robustly spiced thai food, I always end up bringing a large sized portion back with me because of the pacing that I go through to deal with the flavor sensations while eating.  You just sort of slow down when faced with high levels of spice, you know? Savoring it, processing the effects and the sensational highs, that sort of thing. Here, though, I breezed through most of the meal and left with only a tiny bit in styrofoam. And don't get me wrong: the portion size is GENEROUS, so I was able to eat quite a bit in one sitting. But, again, all of the ingredients were tasty, so having a full stomach of it was satisfying enough.  After the meal we were treated to complimentary coconut ice cream. It was really enjoyable and a great way to top off the meal and dining experience. All said and done, I can see this being a place that we come to monthly to scratch a thai itch, though I'm going to default to level 5 spiciness from now on.

B1qdgx7YOSJmH_DmHMzhKA.text: We had a great lunch here today and were very pleased with the food. This is my family's favorite Thai place in the valley and their food is excellent. We had a wonderful Pad Thai and delicious Panang! Thank your for your good service and great food!  We definitely will be back again soon!

MVM01add3UFqXiyn4selhQ.text: I stumbled upon this gem a couple weeks ago and I've been here several times since then. Their Thai iced tea is perfection. It's not overly sweet and has the exact ratio of milk and tea combined. I am delighted (pun intended) every time I eat here!  The staff is attentive and welcoming. Dee was my server today and she made sure to check in with me and offer me suggestions for my curry bowl. I really appreciate servers who are gifted with the ability to know when to approach the table and when to give space. Thanks Dee! I also really enjoy the music they play, it assists with the over all digestion of the experience, including the food! Their lunch specials are outstanding and the soups they offer at the lunch buffet are amazingggg! A+ all around. Delightful even!

mkocoI1zqYnW6tvyKK1UBA.text: We had an order delivered by Grubhub. Our order was Potstickers, Thai Fried Rice and Pad Woon Sen.  the potstickers were the only acceptable item   The fried rice had zero flavor and the veggies were over cooked and mushy. Also there where some unknown hard little bits in the dish.   The Pad Woon Sen was just bad. The snap peas were so mushy it was disgusting, all the other veggies were over cooked and mushy and once again there was some unknown hard bit.   However none of the above is the purpose of this review. We had been here before and had great food and service. We called in our experience with the food and were pot on hold for quite a while and then the person on the phone told us to call GrubHub for a refund. Ummmmmm..... we should waste more of our time to make this right? No that's your job. We told her that is not our job but thank you we will not be coming back or ordering from here again. So disappointed!!!!!

B3IoEfx2U6HI2-fw9M7JhA.text: I cannot express enough how much I love to eat here!  I generally do takeout as I live close to the restaurant and my order is ready in 10-15 minutes and is always hot - temperature hot, because I get no spice/mild.  I have grown to become quite intolerant to spicy dishes and in this review that is important to note, because a lot of Thai places do not have control over spice level consistently and often cook no spice/mild dishes in the same pans as previous spicy orders which ruins the no spice/mild dishes.  I have had several items from the menu and have never once had my food come out with another dish's leftover spice level.  In the two months that I have lived in the area, I have eaten here at least once a week - and will certainly continue to do so based on the quality level of the food and the amazing service provided by the entire staff.  They have a way of really making one feel right at home and welcome!  Thank you Thai Delight staff! ~Sandi

-AU952JnG28MtcaVEkqvtw.text: Went to this place after reading some pretty good Yelp reviews and though the food was decent the wait for food was not worth it. We went on a weekday for dinner, it's a small place and it wasn't even packed. The person who took our order was very nice and quick. But then we had to wait for almost 45 mins for our food to come which got a bit annoying and that's why not more stars. We did not get any update on the order or that food will take time. I ordered the drunken noodles with veggies - medium spicy and it looked really good. Once we started eating the heat started kicking in and not just for me but everyone found it too spicy. The veggies and noodles had a great flavor but unfortunately the spice level was so high that after a point I couldn't taste anything but spices. iBs6QGH44xMGeKnlO_svng.text: Such a special find.  I don't exactly have the highest expectations when it comes to Thai food in the valley.  I feel like California spoiled me with any Asian cuisine so I was happy to find my expectations beyond exceeded with this place.  I was craving yellow curry and this was exactly what I was looking for-- the flavor was spot on and it was enough food for a few rounds of meals for a pretty inexpensive cost.  My boyfriend ordered the pad see ew (extra spicy, although warned), it was his first Thai food experience, and he loved it.  The flavors were even better the next day.  With my check in, I received a free Thai iced tea and the woman at the counter was so accommodating in making it last minute.  This will be our go to spot for Thai food from now on!

4xAlaIKh5vG_brJjIYva-g.text: In the mood for Thai, and in the area, I re-read my review and drove over.  As soon as I was in the parking lot, I recalled a visit some months back. It was a bad experience and I don't know why I didn't update my review at that time. I should have.  Arriving around 8, I observed the place had no diners seated.   The reason for my bad experience was that, the spice level on my first visit was wimpy. So, we opted for "Thai hot." That was treated by, "you ordered it and you can't ask to give it back," said to us before the order was done. Well, I think the cook decided to show this caucasian diner what was what for some reason. The table next to us was already making a fuss about the meal being inedible because of the spice level. The server just said, "you ordered, no take back." We got pure chili spice and the only "flavor" was fire.  That recollection and the empty dining room had us spinning on our heels.  I guess if you like Asain food with zero spice, you'll like it here. Once again I find myself having been too generous with my first reaction.  I've travelled to Thailand and all over Asia. It's possible to get spicy hot with amazing flavor profiles.   Now I'll remember to give this place a pass.

kGcVsnMy_xiLGUCaiG4zOg.text: This is our favorite Thai restaurant in Ahwatukee. Why? We've made it a mission to eat-at and rate all Thai restaurants in and around Ahwatukee. Now, we've primarily "taken-out" so we can't always rate atmosphere or service, but we definitely have a string handle on the food. This place is the best in the area. Why? And why only 4 stars? Read on.  Food: The food is excellent. Extremely large portions, very well spiced and heat appropriate. Super flavorful (this is huge for me, it is not bland or boring, and not mainstream blah-Thai like other restaurants), authentic and fresh with appropriate seasonings. Price is about the same as every other Thai restaurant in the area, give or take a dollar or two. Because of the size, we always get two meals out of each entree, this is great.  Although we haven't eaten on-site, when we go inside to pick up, it's easy to see that the atmosphere is very nice. It's modern and clean and spacious and comfortable.  So, why only 4 stars? Each time we've ordered take out over the phone from Thai Delight, the time is *always* longer than what they quote, not by a couple minutes, usually by 15 to 20 minutes, which means, the food takes approximately 40 minutes to be ready. This wouldn't be a huge issue if that's what you're told up front, but when you're told "20 minutes" and you show up 20 minutes later, then wait another 20 minutes, consistently, that can get a bit frustrating. Fortunately, after the first bite or two, it's so good that the frustration dissipates. This could be easily addressed and made better with an apology or even an acknowledgment from the staff. They lose a full rating star for this, not because it happened once, but because it's a regular occurrence and we haven't seen any improvement in this process.  Would I recommend Thai Delight? Yes, absolutely! If you're phoning in an order to go, just be prepared that the wait time they quoteyou may be quite a bit longer. Give yourself a bit of extra time if you are really hungry. Definitely our favorite Thai food in and around Ahwatukee.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside

WKBEGT7W9RVUsMNFWPm3jg.text: Consistency is key when it comes to food. It may vary based on service, but the foundation of a restaurant should always serve up and produce awesome food all of the time. I'm preaching to the choir. Since moving to Phoenix, I've found Thai Delight to not let me down. It's my favorite local Thai restaurant. Their menu offers many of the Thailand flavors along with soups full of flavor and apps that won't disappoint. Caution to those that love the spice. My advice is to start low and work your way up. I love spicy food and three stars is about the top of my tolerance scale. They can put fire in your belly  if you want them to, but what's the point? Life is a balance after all and enjoying the food.   Their sampler is an opportunity to taste the various apps. Chicken satay is good and hot with a good coating of spices. Drunken noodle and Thai fried rice is always good. They're full of veggies with a generous portion of large white chicken meat.  Well worth what you pay for and what you get.

Rwe8CrdjfFqcVIw3J_wcrQ.text: This place is literary one of my favorite Thai places I do a happy dance every time I have it! Service is always friendly and you can tell ingredients are fresh !! Love it !!

74g3kNuV1lueBwb7mDYUmQ.text: How did I miss on this hidden gem? This place is all that you are looking for in an authentic Thai restaurant. We went for a weekday lunch and I couldn't have chosen a better place.  We were seated immediately and this place looks clean and modern. They have a salad and soup bar, the salad bar had some fresh berries and grapes which is a rare find in Thai restaurants.  I ordered a bowl of tom Kha soup and panang curry. The curry came with an option of white or fried rice. The tom Kha soup is one of the best I have tried. Their coconut milk used was on point, so was the flavor in it with the chicken well done. My favourite dish of the day was definitely the panang curry, it was hot and was really fresh. The curry was delicious with the side of fried rice. I went with a spice level of 3 and it was just perfect. It came along with spring roll which was equally appetizing. I enjoyed the meal to every bit.  The lunch portion was excellent and so is their price. With the delicious food they serve, the price is decent. This place is definitely on the top of my rotation.

Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 52. Panang Curry

b7l1A97Mh2HhSTv-jb1UmA.text: So for the longest time I swore off of Thai food. But after binge watching Netflix shows all day and lots of take out Thai being ordered in the shows, I craved and I caved.   This place is amazing! The food and ingredients were so fresh. The spice level was exactly what I expected in the numbers. Definitely ordering from here again!   **no photos as hunger came first and at this point if I took a photo I'd be both embarrassed and proud of the carnage lol**

0QLrqut4JJGyiXXHk6AYYQ.text: OK you can choose to believe me or not - but this is the BEST Thai food I've ever had. And I've had Thai food all over the Northwest (new to the area and happened upon this place! What luck).   The Tom Kha is spiced beautifully. You can tell the ingrediants such as lemongrass and coconut milk are fresh and correctly sourced. I love the texture of the cabbage. The shrimp is SO good - totally mild !! No weird "fishy" or grimy taste/texture that I can't stand about some restaurant's shrimp.  Now the green curry - *Wow* so healthy. My mouth dropped when I saw they added eggplant! An often ignored ingredient that I think should be a default. And it just contained a ton of vegetables packed in there which I love. The curry itself is SO rich and fantastic.  This is gonna be my new Thai spot in Phoenix, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2eyqa5lOuzSL_92F7yul5A.text: We had a nice experience here, and will be back. My husband and I both had a spicy noodle dish. It came out looking like it was going to be bland, but it turned out to be very tasty - and spicy! The service was very friendly and the restaurant was clean and tastefully decorated. They weren't serving lunch specials on Memorial Day but that was understandable.

vdzQUhjK4D7ppKOkApT5sw.text: A fav for lunch with my office crew. We enjoy their soup and salad bar and their lunch portions are just right.  I always get their garlic and pepper chicken. It comes with a choice of white rice or fried rice (always get fried rice) and a fried spring roll. Since I like spicy food, I get it hot.   Its quick, the staff are friendly and the food is tasty.

DV63FY_9mj67hEYJnSq-Iw.text: Modern and clean.  Friendly owner and service staff.  Be aware, the entrees are large (can easily feed at least two people if not more)   If you check in through Yelp, you get an Xl glass of iced Thai tea or Thai coffee. Yum! Very nice bonus   Customer-wise, it was a good mix of Asians and non-Asians. I think that is a very good sign for any eatery.  We ordered-- 1) the appetizer plate called Thai Delight--coconut shrimp, crab Rangoon, fried rolls, fresh roll, chicken satay, two each. Good flavors, only that the various sauces Can be a little more flavored.   2) the Drunken Spaghetti with Seafood (one of the house specialities)--hubby said it had a good balance of veggies, spaghetti and seafood. He was pleased with it.   3) the Pad Thai (how can I not)--traditional shrimp and chicken but you can switch out to other meats if you like. It became better after I asked for a whole extra lime to squeeze onto it (they charged me a dollar for the lime), and after I requested to have the fish sauce brought to our table (watch it though--their fish sauce had chilis in it, which I did not expect).   Not related to the food or the service but just be aware that when we had dinner there today (Nov 3rd, 2018), a customer got locked in in the bathroom since the doorknob mechanism probably got stuck. It took about 15 minutes to get unstuck by one of the kitchen staff members--bless him! All I'm saying is, better check and double check that the door won't get stuck when you decide to enter the restroom...  Final verdict--we would return

s667SQ6965kW0hctryfF4A.text: This is my delight. The food is exquisite. The seafood is fresh and well cooked. I love that I can order a fried rice with an overload of seafood in it. I recommend this place for anyone who loves Thai food or to anyone who's looking to try something very delicious. You receive a lot of food so if sharing... one is order is enough. If it's just for you there will be left overs. I can't wait to explore into new dishes and find new favorite. For now I'm loving my SeaFood chow mien and fried rice.  I'll let you know when another favorite is upon me.

pG7UcH27Hxq6v2edqGzl-g.text: Yummy foods, but their spicy level 3 is too hot for us, we usually order spicy level 5 at other thai restaurant lol  I love their pineapple curry and drunken noodles

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KS92LAFtwylPkjR6ZutApA.text: My first time trying Thai Delight and I'm a fan!  I arrived around 11:40 today, hoping to beat the lunch crowd.  When I arrived I was the only guest in the restaurant, maybe the first guest of the day because they opened at 11.  I was greeted immediately.  While dining, business picked up a bit, 7 more people came in. There was plenty of available seating.   Similar to other Thai restaurants, Thai Delight offers free and unlimited hot soup and salad to accompany your meals.  The salad bar is slightly different.  It's just regular toss salad but they also have tomatoes, cucumbers, green onions, strawberries and grapes.  How nice?!  They did not have the peanut dressing most are used to.  Instead there salad bar comes with some sort of Thai Vinaigrette maybe.  It's delicious.  I had 2 servings.  The soup also taste a lot fresher than other Thai places I've tried.  Some Thai soup taste like it's loaded with soy and sodium to me.  This soup did not!  I ordered the L3 - Pad Thai.  I keep it simple! The portions were HUGE.  I can't imagine what the dinner portions are like (see pics). Again, the food didn't taste like it was loaded with soy and sodium.  No after taste from the eggs and chicken (which is what I've experienced at other places). I opted for level 1 for my spice level - it was perfect.  So was the spring roll that accommodated my meal.   I was in and out, full and pleased within 40 minutes.  Probably could have been sooner but I sat and enjoyed another helping of salad before I left.  I also used my check it offer and got a free Thai Tea (large).  I've never tried Thai Tea because I didn't' like the idea of milk I my tea but I rarely decline a free check in offer   I noticed on the menu it said if you want more OR less ice in your Thai Tea, it'll be an extra dollar.  Really?!   All of this goodness cost me less than 9 bucks (without the tip) and I have leftovers for dinner this evening or lunch tomorrow.  I would most certainly go back, next time I'm bringing friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Leftovers and I ate a good portion. I can&#39;t imagine what the dinner portion looks like. It&#39;s a win for me
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch for Less than $9 bucks without the tip
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad bar with strawberries, grapes, green onions and NO peanut sauce. A little different from the others

xC65PdNq8dhyWYQE6SHvhg.text: Food and service were good. Delicious green curry and coconut pineapple ice cream dessert this visit. Will come again!

ZLkPXmcUHEzYz4UgQASysA.text: My husband took me here the past couple of weeks after he stumbled upon it during their grand opening week.  He kept raving how great it was, and I was at first a bit skeptical because I have my usual favorite Thai spot.  But he was definitely right! I ordered my usual meal of a vegetable medley with some type of meat covered in garlic sauce.  It's called Mixed Vegetables Delite at this location.  And with me currently being pregnant, I got it at a mild spice level. It was absolutely delicious!  The dish had just the right amount of sauce to be flavorful, without it being too soup-y.  It came with a side of rice so it was nice to mix it all in get some of the sauce on the rice.  The spice level was just perfect for me!  Although I"m not sure I would categorize it as mild....although it could just be the pregnancy talking.  It had a small kick to it, which is what I was looking for!  But for those who hate spice and want the lowest spice setting, I think the mild still might be a bit too much.  But like I said, my taste buds have been a bit out of wack lately. My husband ordered the Pad Thai both times we went, so I can only assume it must be amazing!  I tried a small bit of the tofu and it was great!  A bit crispy on the outside, but had the normal soft texture on the inside.  It was flavored so well that my husband didn't even realize it was tofu LOL.  He thought it might have been some scallop or type of seafood. HAH!   They also give you a small bowl of coconut ice cream, although I'm not sure if this is the norm, a lunch special, or just a random act of kindness.  But it definitely helped complete our meal and the coconut was not too overpowering, which I loved! We will definitely be making this our usual spot from now on!

MiAM4X2uub5tra2ehF7-gA.text: Located in a strip mall. Went in for dinner and dining room was empty. Lots of in and out traffic picking up to go orders. Went with the servers recommendation of pork delight at a Thai hot heat rating. Food was good and he heat temperature was just how I liked it. Server was great and attentive. After my meal he brought me a small bowl of ice cream, which was a nice surprise. Dinner was right around $10 for the entree.

fbTbide1msOqTLBJyfHepQ.text: I rarely give a 5 star rating but this local gem won me over. It's not super fancy but the decor was really nice. Modern for ol' Ahwatukee which is a nice change of pace. The service was authentic and genuine. Not rushed and really attentive. And the food was outstanding. Hubby got the pineapple fried rice and I got the panang chicken curry both medium and was it spicy but not burn your face off. We also ordered the fresh spring rolls which were very good, peanut sauce not the best that I've ever had but good. We ordered mango and sweet rice for dessert which was delicious. They gave us complimentary cup or coconut ice cream with mango which was absolutely amazing. Creamy and refreshing after a spicy meal. Only down side according to my better half is they serve Pepsi product and he's a Dt. Coke guy. He needs more water in his life so he dealt with it. Great place, lots of options and spice levels for every palate.  We'll definitely be going back! So glad to have another Thai house in the neighborhood!

v0H3kwa8e8qyv8eK9oebhQ.text: I just so happened to be in the area with a co-worker and we were craving some thai food. When we walked in, I was very impressed with the decor. Very cute and modern! I ordered the coconut soup, pad thai with chicken, she order the drunken noodles, and the same soup. We both were in thai heaven! It was actually her first time trying thai food and she couldn't believe what her taste buds were missing. We both live in Gilbert and kept saying how we wished they were closer however I know I will be coming back here :) I will be taking my husband with me next. Service was great and food was wonderful.

pzvVZ4BjT0CPm6mKht7AMg.text: I met a friend here for lunch yesterday. I ordered the lunch curry chicken with jasmine rice. The curry sauce had to most delicious sweet flavor. I am already wanting to go back today. The lunch special also comes with salad and egg drop soup. The atmosphere is pleasant inside. The waitress was attentive and friendly. My friend ordered the mango salad with shrimp. She said it is her favorite.

8d7bDyXe78JrMv_u2eOYpg.text: I think quality over quantity describes my feeling with this place. Their entrees are giant but lacking the finesse I anticipated. We ordered Pad Thai, Cashew Chicken, and Coconut soup. Cashew chicken shouldn't be fried.... and baked tofu in soup, tofu in pad Thai was the same. We paid a bit  to throw out most of the food simply because it doesn't taste good. But 4 stars for effort, we support small business for customer service and higher quality standards and attention to detail. Hope they can take my comments into consideration!

Fwb6IE7d5ba5csDrrKHmow.text: Excellent restaurant. I believe it is family owned because it is the same people every time I go but they are so sweet. The free ice cream they give you is to die for

haJ_kK_2LC6biwMbVlVjFQ.text: Good flavor and big portions. Had chicken satay, drunken noodle with pork, and my mom got the basil fried rice with shrimp. The chicken was cooked nicely, but the peanut sauce was a bit too sweet. Huge portions so can't complain too much. The entrees however lacked pizazz, there was was no color on anything, like everything was cooked on low heat in a saute pan as opposed to a hot wok. My noodles were all broken in pieces before I dug in. Disappointing because the flavor was nice. +1 for complimentary ice cream

4hbOkGcOmGW_mwSnVsS6Uw.text: This is a sit down, strip mall restaurant. The food was fantastic, great service, and a good value. The fresh coconut milk (served in the coconut) a was fun. I had the Garlic pepper pork and my wife had the Mango curry. Both were equally good. We finished with coconut pineapple ice cream.

FWXKsoJbKzoBVu9Iehu67g.text: So good!! The restaurant is lovely inside and our service was great. Yellow curry simply delicious, nice touch with the scoop of ice cream after! Will be back.

fhkBiNLeol1oOHYoB8U2YA.text: Fantastic food, great and fast service and at a good price. Definitely coming back. Surprisingly not crowded. No explanation why. For sure top review from me.

Hu1XIZfxSV51WsEvJDmcCQ.text: This is a very nice place.    A little hard to find as it is tucked in a non street facing strip mall.     Very clean and good service.    The owner introduced himself.    I had the yellow curry.  With a medium heat. I will ask for more heat when I come back.     I'm glad to have a new Thai restaurant in the  neighborhood.

Lq2ZfsvVX_3w4JRQQX8QTQ.text: 1st time visit to Thai Delight and it will not be our last. The food was delicious and the portions size was huge. The prices were moderate. Our waitress was courteous. The evening ended with a surprise complimentary coconut/pineapple ice cream dessert.

5Q2xNN7paI6kXGHH2_d-aQ.text: Takeout on a weekday night. Delicious Panng curry that I stretched into four yes FOUR meals by adding extra vegetables. Pad Thai is solid. Delicious chicken larb. So nice to have this in the foothills.

0TDiY9GiL4vooq-lrTmgPA.text: No lie, this place is one of the best Thai food I ever had! Services was very good and food came fast. Im not a local here but when I return to Tempe Im definitely coming here. Highly recommend!!!

I have to say this place took me by absolute surprise of how flavorful the food is and how filling the meal was! Got the Thai Fried rice and the Pad See-Ew and it was DELICIOUS! Took me and my girlfriend by absolute surprise and blew us out of the water! Very good food, very clean place, and very good people! Keep it up!

IjBpgILov-LF8z6WQgQOJg.text: Food was great and quick!!! I ordered the spicy basil lunch special. The only hesitation I would have would be the ground chicken. A little odd to me but tasted good.

QMh_Z3Y1NpcEgqJQ5TGrqg.text: Super fast and friendly.  Super clean.  The food is always good, and always fresh.  I found Thai Delight to have very consistent spice levels, etc.  You know exactly what you will get and it will always be great.

k09ojO2GIQ7lDl0yGUNiag.text: Several Thai restaurants have opened in the Ahwatukee area over the last couple years and this one is by far the best!  Food is always fresh, hot and delicious. Service is great and the portion sizes are huge!  I've had takeout from here a half a dozen times and have never been disappointed.

pFR2f2ul_MwJ6fjWNsH42g.text: I wanted to try a healthier choice, so decided on their "grilled" seafood. Sorry, but not impressed since it looked and tasted like sauteed and was overly sweet.

7Z0e2DeAhFbEqmXschQetA.text: While the food was good, probably 4 stars, the wait was so long. We saw a few people leave and clearly the to-go orders were also taking forever. Also, I didn't realize I sent my husband here before for take-out and he reminded me that he had to wait forever at that time, too.

jzcwS4ItAUoJwm1Y-c5RYA.text: The food was delish and the restaurant was very clean! You can tell the owner takes great pride and passion into serving healthy and authentic Thai food.  Can't wait to come back the next time we are in town!!

3q4a1jRV0Q0DlhPRTgxu4g.text: Wonderful !! Stopped by this afternoon for some take out .. I came here because of yelp reviews and my neighbor recommended it !!  I ordered drunken noodles and pad se ew .. while I waited the hostess brought out a few bottled waters as well as some bowls of ice cream for my kids which was very nice  ( but sadly my kids are lactose intolerant ) .. food was very good and portions were huge !!  Definitely will be a return customer !!! Stop by and check them out !!

25sjALYghX1WrQ0JDbwN1Q.text: This is the best Thai in Phoenix. They use the freshest ingredients and every dish is cooked just right.

cMgl9C4ugM9HDIwaMOaAwg.text: Their food is just top notch super awesome! Very nice people and the place is always clean!

gCpMaaDqEVDKCNUD-uuzLA.text: This has become our favorite father-daughter date spot.   I've been here probably 10 times with my dad/other family members and every time my dad has gotten something different and LOVED IT. He's normally not someone to compliment food or be very impressed but this place is so good.   I get a cup of tom kha soup (it's honestly big) and a side of fried rice (why is their fried rice like crack? I've never felt this way before about fried rice ) and I can't stray away. Yummmm. I hope they stay in business forever.  Best Thai place in Ahwatukee. I've had everything else and nothing compares.

bG6-XlYqhecKUNxjYaen6w.text: Encouraged by all the 5 star reviews, we decided to check this place out. There was no wait and the atmosphere is cute, but beyond that, there's not much I can say about it that's positive. Ok, so first we ordered the fresh rolls and it was literally a bunch of store bought salad mix stuffed into rice paper wrappers with some unseasoned tofu. Hardly any mint or noodles to be found either, so yeah. I brought this to our servers attention, and instead of offering to take it off the bill (which would have been the right thing to do) she tried to convince us that it's authentic and every restaurant does it differently.  My dad got their wonton soup, which was way too salty, and ended up having to throw a bunch of the lettuce from the previously mentioned rolls in it just to make it palatable. After a few bites he decided to take the rest home cause he could fix it at least  For his main course he ordered the mango curry with duck. Our server assured him it was mild in term of spiciness because he told her he didn't want anything too spicy. Well, not only was this dish really spicy, but the curry sauce was way too sweet- it seems they used mango syrup rather than fresh mango to make it. I didn't try the duck as I don't eat meat, but he was concerned about it's freshness since the sauce was so sweet and spicy that it was impossible to tell  As for myself, I ordered the pad woon sen with tofu. I love pad woon sen, and have had many in my lifetime. Sadly, this one was terrible. Greasy, overcooked (noodles and vegetables both) and the sauce was terrible.   I should also mention that at no point during the meal did our server ask us how our food was.   Both of us hardly ate our entrees, and as much as I hate wasting food, I knew I wouldn't end up eating it if I took it home and my dad wasn't up to making what would be a monumental effort to fix his dish (plus he was uncertain as to whether the duck was fresh)  When we informed our server that we didn't want to pack any of the entrees to go, she didn't say anything. Two nearly untouched entrees and no attempt to find out why.  Honestly we should have been paid to eat this subpar food rather than paying them for it!  I love Thai food and have never been to a bad Thai restaurant in my life, but I guess there's a first time for everything.

GD4JUVunvC6E68RaR10RxA.text: Found this amazingly authentic Thai restaurant while on a business trip!  The food is fresh and flavorful and the portions were huge!  I've been to Thailand many times and this place is the real deal.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious!  Authentic and fresh!!

MEZWjKK-frxAqSTOn37lMg.text: Everything was super delish and service was great! This is quite a way from home but will definitely be coming back again, soo worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai delight platter...whoa! Every single thing tasted fresh and to be blunt...Orgasmic!
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Pad Thai...omg! To die for!
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Tom yum...so yummers!!!

0Dl2pyb0EjQCzXmbX8Of8Q.text: I have been to Thai Delight several times now.  I am hooked!  I like spicy food.  Okay, I love spicy food.  I have been ordering everything at a level FIVE, which is their spiciest level.  One day it was phenomenal and I could not stop eating it.  The next two times, it was actually a bit hotter than expected.  Still, I am addicted to the heat!  I keep going back for more because it is amazing.  So far, I have had the Pad Thai, the Drunken Noodles and the Garlic Noodles.  I like the Drunken Noodles the best, so I have ordered those on repeat visits.  If you go during lunch time, you get salad bar included.  I think they also have soup, but I have never tried it.  My daughter likes the grapes they have in the salad bar.  Thai Delight is reasonably priced.  Most of what I get is $7.95 during lunch and $9.95 at dinner.  Considering I get two meals out of it most of the time, it is a definite bargain!  The restaurant has only been open for a few months, but already seems to have a loyal following.  That said, they were empty on Friday night.  I felt really bad that we were one of only two or three tables in there.    They even brought us coconut pineapple ice cream for dessert, which happens to be my absolute favorite ice cream from childhood!  They have earned my business for sure!  I urge you to go to Thai Delight when you are in Ahwatukee for some awesome food.  It is way better than the Ahwatukee Thai Basil and service is way friendlier, too!

O_YGnZoPs1DHz-EGp_1H_A.text: Went because of great reviews and we were not disappointed.  4 adults and 2 small kids.  All the adults know good Thai food and even cook some dishes.  Pad Thai was one of the best we have had anywhere.  The mango curry was a big hit too.  We also tried the Mossaman curry and the grilled seafood.  Service was very attentive but it was a quiet Tuesday night.  Overall the food was excellent and, for the price, a good deal.  Even though we were too full for dessert, to our delight a final course of pineapple ice cream was served to everyone and was a big hit with the small kids.  Will de

v3ge875yGkSVwbNrtx21Xw.text: My personal favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix. The curry is the best I have found and the other dishes (Tom Yum, Tom Kha, Pad Thai, Larb, etc.) I have tried are equally good. The service has always been incredibly good as well. They even give free ice cream as desert for dinner. By far the best Thai restaurant in AZ.

LhZ7M_TcRg_4Wgi_QFmaJw.text: This is one of my favorite Ahwatukee restaurants. The drunken noodles and ginger chicken are among our favorites. I like my Thai hot, but not so hot that it obscures the rest of the flavors. They deliver on this perfectly. The pineapple-coconut ice cream that comes at the end of dinner is amazing. Great service too. We're always recognized and greeted with a smile.

XcuxfYQnno7Oys6FRGabBA.text: Ordered delivery through Grub Hub and although the Grub Hub app was estimating at one point that the order was going to take 90 minutes, food arrived pretty quickly and was hot. Excellent food all around - probably the best green papaya salad and green curry we've had in Phoenix. The food we asked for with no spice was appropriately mild and the food we ordered hot had a really good kick but also great flavor (this restaurant has 2 higher spice levels above hot - be careful). Will definitely be ordering from here again.

vYXy0WRIGvoIDNk5CRH4xQ.text: Yuuuum! First time here and it was awesome! Very clean and nicely decorated. Great customer service and a great early dinner! I had the Mango delight

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nJIuJhZmRpj6KW4CrvDsww.text: I'm not only giving them 5 stars for the excellent food, but 5 stars fir their great service! I placed a Togo order and was greeted with a warm hello. I was given a cold bottle of water while I waited for my food to be bagged up. Nice touch! It's the little things :)   Food was great! Yellow curry was full of flavor and fresh! Mango sticky rice dessert was perfect! I will definitely be back very soon!

6p6kIxR-Mehc996hkrXjEA.text: Best Thai in Ahwatukee! The spice scale is just right and they always have seating available. Prices are normal for Thai, not cheap and not too expensive. The quality of food is great and it's always prepared to order. I haven't had a dish that wasn't delicious! (And I think I've tried it all!)

lCiX_vv1nvEQu6WYuGnuvw.text: Food is fresh and tasty. The orange chicken was delicious, would highly recommend. It comes with veggies and rice. We even got complimentary free ice cream at the end as a desert. Service was excellent and you want a take out or dine in, either way you can't go wrong. Try it!

1xR4Xua2jRWfu7LVyP0IYA.text: I consider myself a bit of a food snob; I'm crazy picky when it comes to my food. I say this because I need you to understand just how amazing the food here is. From the first bite of my appetizer to the last bite of my dessert, I truly was delighted.  Even though the food is delicious enough to justify going broke by eating here every single day, that's not the only reason to do so. The service was some of the best I've ever experienced. The staff was very friendly, conversational, and genuinely happy to see us.  I got my favorite Thai dish, Pad Thai, knowing full well what it should taste like and Thai Delight delivered. This place is phenomenal and you should definitely go there today for lunch!

Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sticky rice with mango... Phenomenal stuff.
Photo of Thai Delight - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Thai Fried Rice was super excellent. Get some when you get here!

z3EVCDOZqMdqc98a9SD9ow.text: Really large portions and fresh vegetables in the dishes. The service was also great! Would recommend.

qi8VXjlbeem0oQ06k_CnyA.text: I ordered take out of pad thai and chicken satay for a quick dinner. The pad thai was okay but a little bland. My dogs were just fed the rest of the satay as it was very rubbery. It's what I imagine a Gumby toy would feel like, if it were marinated in peanut sauce and grilled at a low temp for a few hours. There's quite a few other options in the area for much better quality meat and ingredients.

f1i6g_RsZIi4R9Vw4xMg4A.text: Great new addition of Thai food around the area. I had a lunch order to go, called in and food was ready in 15 min. Staff was friendly and welcoming. The food had a good kick to it and flavor. I wish the lunch menu had a few more curry options. Other than that it was a nice and tasty experience.
