FfZ-2gEH8P4hzCKa5Xi_Mw.text: We have had this place multiple times and every time it is great.  I love the curry and the crispy egg rolls are amazing with the sauce.  The people are friendly and the prices are reasonable.  Would recommend if you are looking for good Thai curry.

TXf1ObvANGDQDtsInR5MwQ.text: Awesome Thai food! Great and ultra friendly service. Huge menu. They listen when you want it hot (so many other places don't listen when you ask for hot - as if you can't handle it).  Don't miss the green tea ice cream.

UKjPVltTTvUhNp3m2hmamQ.text: Good food and excellent customer service Enjoyed our dining experience. If you are looking for a good Thai food this is the place to go.

BqjUwXSpPyLd3L0C62Qgvw.text: Great food and service, I will definitely be back again! Try the Thai tea and the drunken noodles if you go.

yvbQ1fD4bjouUAfjtnxGXg.text: Just finished eating at Thai Delight on Chandler Blvd in Awatukee and it was amazing. I am a Thai native and have finally found an authentic Thai restaurant.  I had the Minced Pork Salad, and it was fantastic. It was the most authentic and tastey Thai food I have had since moving to Arizona.  The owners, Kung and Mike, we're attentive and made us feel at home.  Our waiter Carlo was always on the spot with water and Pepsi refills and generraly provided great service.   I highly recommend Thai Delight to all Thai and anyone wanting to experience an amazing and authentic Thai meal.

StjHNHdioJ1tj_-8nA_8yw.text: FINALLY!! After just about a year of living in Phoenix, I found my go-to Thai place! Moving here from the North East, I wanted - no, NEEDED to find a Thai place that I could treat myself to every once and experience the amazing flavors of Thai food. After searching far and wide, being disappointed time and time again, I finally found Thai Delight.  The pictures looked promising, and the reviews were positive. But a taste test was needed to see if it had what it takes to be my #1 go to thai place.  The first time I came here for dinner when moving into my new apartment. I got the spicy basil fried rice with beef. Let me tell you, they do not skimp out on the meat here. There was a lot of meat and it was very tender and good! There's also a lot of vegetables. Actually, there's just a whole lot of everything, since the portions are huge! The price is right, too, just around $10 or so for the dish (based on your protein choice).   My boyfriend got the drunken noodles. He really loved them, but he likes 0 spice so when I tried it I thought they were good, but not to my liking. Thankfully I tried them the second time we came and got the right amount of spice for me and they were great! The dishes have such a deep flavor that makes me want more and more.  The first time we went, we got the spring roll appetizer. The server (who I think may also be the owner) made them without mint for me, since I don't like it. They were really good. They come with two sauces: one is sweet and a more thin sauce, and the other is a peanut sauce that is very thick. Although I didn't love either of them on their own, I found that oddly enough mixing them made it the perfect taste.  The second time we went was during lunch. They have soup (I'm not sure exactly what kind, I think it was like an egg drop soup?) and a salad bar. I got a plate of salad, and the dressing was the same thin sweet sauce from the spring rolls, so I didn't love that. There were also grapes and cherries so I got a whole bowl full of cherries! My boyfriend got the soup too which tasted amazing, but unfortunately I forgot to grab a cup before leaving.  Overall, with this place being right down the street from me (literally... walking distance), I will be back many, many times. The prices are fair, the portions are huge, they don't skimp on anything in their dishes, and the service is very attentive. I'm so glad that I found this place and I can't wait to get it again!

y_zvi7qidE_hMOSyUBESUw.text: AMAZING!!!! This is a must try restaurant. We've eaten at Thai Basil for years and decided to give this place a try and what a pleasant surprise... the food was so tasty and the waitress was so nice and attentive. The food was delivered to our table fast and piping hot!

TqMlFjQuk9i2zx-K357jSA.text: Great food and great service my new favorite Thai restaurant. The soup was the best and really fresh.

naYR6alD9e1C_3fmipvqQA.text: Great food. Pad Thai was more authentic than most Thai places.  They provide soup and salad for free during lunch... Very cool.  It's a nicely decorated place and since it's new it's very clean.   Nice people too

rJk1S5y3KYSFkRkWVGhbbw.text: This little hidden gem is truly a "delight"! Had the fried crab puffs which were amazing and the pad Thai, which was a generous helping.  Little surprises around every corner like their license to allow you to bring in your own alcohol and the little scoop of coconut pineapple ice cream at the end of the meal. Love this place!

nVXNRjI70eYe4UqCht32rg.text: I've been here a few times but I was sold after the first.  The owners really know how to treat their guests. They are always attentive even when they are slammed. I will be coming back again. In fact I just ordered take out!

5hc1IwlpEuLCSMJdwT81Nw.text: Every time I come here I'm never disappointed when it comes to food.  The last time I was here the food was sensational, the service exceptional and the server was beautiful!!!  They put the Clemson vs Alabama College "Passball" championship game for me. I was happy Clemson won and even more happier since my server was gorgeous!  This time...not so much.  My server was nothing short of bipolar.  I walked in and she greeted me like she had missed me!  Lol. "Where have you been?" She asked.  I ordered water and a Thai Iced tea. I told her I would need a minute to order.  When she came back I ordered the Shrimp and chicken fried rice! Medium spice.  A True work of Art!  Battery low so I couldn't take a pic.  Anyway I showed her the yelp free Thai tea check in and she rambled something about her customers this and customers that....allow me to back track a little.  When I ordered the Pinapple Chicken AND shrimp fried rice she says "That comes with 2 shrimp".  I said 2 shrimp?  She again rambled about that because shrimp is more expensive they only put 2 and because it's not just the chicken order there is less chicken...LOL.  So I had to ask.  But it's not just 2 pieces of chicken right?  I just realized that I took up a table for 4 and it was busier than normal.  Maybe that's why the attitude.  She never came back to ask if everything was good or to refill my water.  The food is amazing!  The coconut ice cream is the perfect complementary touch (given to me by another server.) The attitude made me uncomfortable to day the least.  Please bring back that beautiful Thai girl!!!  Otherwise, you lost me as a customer.  I gave 3 stars based on the portion and quality of food.  I still tipped 20% for the cooks who know their craft.  I won't be coming back here but you should!  Again, the food is A+

EV_6Fs8Y0AvwTWAqkqE_6w.text: Friendly Service, fair prices.  We've been customers since they opened.  We've been there many times and never disappointed. Our favorites  include eggplant entree, avocado curry bowl, beef salad, drunken noodles.

JN6CHiOACMAVuqK7vvDkzA.text: Maybe I am a Thai snob, but this place didn't set my taste buds aflame.  Perhaps we ordered wrong.  We selected the coconut shrimp and the spicy basil noodles.  While the coconut shrimp were quite good, with a pleasantly crispy and coconutty shell, the noodles were uninspired with a flat "meh" taste.  The basil flavor was not popping, and the noodles were slightly overdone.  Till we meet again, Thai Delight.

2nsuKI3NHDdAZIUfYZwjxA.text: Clean restaurant and good services. Fried tofu, craft fried rice and curry chicken were yummy.
